hero.mainText1: No more waiting for your customers.

description.card1: Having to call customers, organize queues... Store operations have hidden challenges related to 'waiting time'.
description.card2: From issuing tickets to calling with a single QR code, we create a new, stress-free store experience for both customers and staff.
description.card3: For all such stores, we provide a web service that eliminates customer 'waiting' and supports smoother store operations.

merit.title: Introducing 'Q-Pass' brings happy changes for both stores and customers.

descriptions.title: Improved operational efficiency
descriptions.value: Calling customers is done with a single button. Staff no longer need to go and call them or manage the queue. This allows them to focus on tasks that directly contribute to sales, such as customer service, cooking, and product preparation.

descriptions.title: Smooth operations
descriptions.value: Guide customers without confusion even during peak hours, and easily keep track of the situation inside and outside the store. New staff can operate it easily, reducing training costs.

customer.title: Improve customer satisfaction and repeat rates

descriptions.title: Eliminate waiting time stress
descriptions.value: Customers no longer have to just wait in front of the store. Being able to spend their time freely until their turn comes reduces frustration with waiting and improves satisfaction upon visiting.

descriptions.title: Create visit opportunities
descriptions.value: Customers who gave up on entering because they 'didn't want to wait in line' can now visit with peace of mind. This helps capture a potential customer base and increase visit opportunities.

descriptions.title: Provide a high-quality customer experience
descriptions.value: The comfort of the waiting time improves the overall impression of the store, encouraging repeat visits and word-of-mouth.

step2.title: Preparation & Setup
step2.description: Add store information to the system

step3.title: Introduction & Operation Start
step3.description: Start using from the next day

item1.question: How long does it take to introduce Q-Pass?
item1.answer: You can start using it from the next day at the earliest after applying.

item2.question: Are any special facilities required for introduction?
item2.answer: No special equipment is required; you can easily introduce it with a smartphone or tablet.

item3.question: Is there support after introduction?
item3.answer: Yes, our dedicated support team will assist you after introduction, so please rest assured.

item4.question: Can it be customized for each store?
item4.answer: Yes, we can customize it for each store upon application.

services.title: Q-Pass
services.description: One-touch calling and management. A new waiting experience.

card1.title: Easily select modes!
card1.description: There are no restrictions like dedicated terminals for waiting management or QR code display. You can easily switch modes on any device, such as a tablet or smartphone.

card2.title: Display QR codes without complex settings!
card2.description: No complex settings are required to display the QR code. You can display it with just the 'Display QR Code' button.

card3.title: Customer status is easy to understand!
card3.description: The status is separated for customers who have entered and those who are waiting, so you can see the customer's status at a glance. The number of people is also displayed, allowing for more appropriate responses.

card4.title: Easy queue management!
card4.description: The 'Enter' button makes it easy to process customer entry, the 'Call' button saves you the trouble of calling them, and the 'Cancel' button makes it easy to process customer cancellations.

card5.title: Calling is also a one-touch operation!
card5.description:
By pressing the 'Call' button, a notification is sent to the customer's terminal. The customer can confirm that they have been called by receiving the notification, which reduces the staff's workload.
Also, the display changes to 'Called', making it easier to grasp the customer's status.
card5.supportText: * The customer's screen after pressing 'Call' is

card6.title: Easy exit processing!
card6.description: You can also easily process the exit of customers who have paid. By pressing the 'Exit' button, they are removed from the list of entered customers, allowing staff to grasp the customer's status more accurately.

card1.title: The only information needed is the number of people!
card1.description:
The only information required to issue a ticket is the number of people.
No name or phone number is needed, you can easily issue a ticket with just the number of people.

card2.title: Simple UI!
card2.description:
The screen used by customers has a simple UI, so anyone can operate it without inconvenience.
You can easily see your turn number and cancel with one touch.

card3.title: Predict when you can enter
card3.description:
Based on the information of recently entered customers, you can predict the next available entry time.
This allows customers to predict their turn and wait with peace of mind.

card4.title: Know when you've been called
card4.description:
A notification is sent to the customer's terminal, so they know when they have been called.
Receiving the notification saves the staff the trouble of going to call them, reducing their workload.

modeSelect.title: Which mode will you use?
modeSelect.waitingManagementDesc: Manage your customers' waiting status in real-time.
modeSelect.qrCodeDisplayDesc: Display the QR code for customers to register for waiting.

qrCodeDisplay.title: QR Code for Waiting Registration
qrCodeDisplay.step1: 1. Scan the QR code above with your smartphone.
qrCodeDisplay.step2: 2. Enter the number of people on the displayed page and press the register button.
qrCodeDisplay.step3: 3. We will send you a notification message when it's time to enter.

createEntry.instruction: Please enter the number of people and press the submit button.

customer.calledMessageBody: Your table is ready. Please come in.
customer.scanAgain: Please scan the QR code again.
